title: 2 Simple Ways to Show Pictures in a Zoom Meeting

steps.title: Host or join a Zoom meeting.
steps.content: Host or join a Zoom meeting. If you need help to join a meeting that's already in progress, refer to How to Join a Zoom Meeting on PC or Mac . To host a meeting, open the client, log in, and click New Meeting .

steps.title: Click Chat.
steps.content: Click Chat . You'll see this centered at the bottom of the screen with an icon of a chat bubble. A chat window will open to the right.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It's on the lower right side of the chat window next to an ear-marked piece of paper icon.

steps.title: Choose your photo's location.
steps.content: Choose your photo's location. You can choose to use cloud services like OneDrive , Dropbox , Google Drive , and Box, or you can search your computer.

steps.title: Log in (if you picked a cloud service).
steps.content: Log in (if you picked a cloud service). Before you can share your file, you'll need to log into the cloud service you chose. If you didn't pick a cloud service, you don't need to log in and skip this step.

steps.title: Navigate to and double-click your photo.
steps.content: Navigate to and double-click your photo. The photo will send in the chat and send a notification to all the meeting's participants that they can download it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Host or join a Zoom meeting.
steps.content: Host or join a Zoom meeting. You can click an invite link to join a meeting or tap New Meeting to host a meeting.

steps.title: Tap Share.
steps.content: Tap Share . It's the green icon centered at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Photo.
steps.content: Tap Photo . You'll find this usually in the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Choose the location of your photo.
steps.content: Choose the location of your photo. You can pick a local source if the picture is in your gallery, like "My Files" or you can use a cloud service like "Dropbox" if your photo is stored in the cloud.

steps.title: Tap to choose the photo you want to share.
steps.content: Tap to choose the photo you want to share. You can only share image files (jpg, png, heic, jpeg) and PDFs this way.
